text: This is a list of all tornadoes that were confirmed by local offices of the National Weather Service in the United States in April 2011. ==United States yearly total== ==April== ===April 4 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Monday, April 4, 2011 |- ! scope="col" width="3%" align="center"|EF# ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" width="5%" align="center"|State ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Path length ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Max width ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Damage ! scope="col" width="48%" class="unsortable" align="center"|Summary ! scope="col" width="3%" class="unsortable" align="center"|Refs |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |Ashdown |Little River |AR | |1310 – 1315 | | | |A metal building with a steel beam frame was completely destroyed, a carport was collapsed, and many trees were snapped or uprooted. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |NNE of Hope |Hempstead |AR | |1338 – 1341 | | | |A tractor trailer was flipped over, roofing was pulled from a barn and nine chicken houses, and several trees were snapped or uprooted. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF2 |E of Blevins |Hempstead, Nevada |AR | |1340 – 1342 | | | |Numerous trees were snapped. A small trailer was tossed and four chicken houses were destroyed, killing hundreds of chickens. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |S of Fouke |Miller |AR | |1350 – 1354 | | | |Many trees were snapped or uprooted, of which one fell on a home, puncturing the roof. A large storage building was destroyed, and a second home sustained minor damage. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |Whelen Springs area |Clark |AR | |1408 – 1414 | | | |Shingles and siding were blown off a house, with its television antennae blown over. Numerous trees were blown down, one of which landed on a tractor shed at the residence. A canning shed was destroyed, and a few power poles and power lines were blown down. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |N of Box Springs |Columbia |AR | |1428 – 1429 | | | |A few small barns, several homes, and a garage sustained minor damage, and several trees were snapped or uprooted. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |SE of Norphlet |Union |AR | |1512 – 1513 | | | |An old gas station cover was blown down, several homes sustained minor roof damage, a carport was collapsed on a vehicle, and several trees were snapped or uprooted. A small metal outbuilding sustained structural damage. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |Slater area |Ballard |KY | |1518 – 1522 | | | |Two barns were leveled, and numerous trees were snapped or uprooted. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF2 |Slater |Ballard |KY | |1520 – 1527 | | | |A farm building was destroyed, the second story of a house was removed, and a garage was leveled. Several additional homes sustained roof damage, two mobile homes were overturned, and four chicken barns were either destroyed or heavily damaged. Numerous farm buildings and grain bins were destroyed, and numerous trees were snapped or uprooted. A mobile home was shifted slightly off its foundation. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |N of Heath |McCracken |KY | |1530 – 1531 | | | |The roof of a metal farm building was lifted, with two parked vehicles in the structure heavily damaged, and large tree limbs were downed. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |S of Greenville |Muhlenberg |KY | |1655 – 1702 | | | |One mobile home was overturned and destroyed, another was shifted off its foundation, a camper trailer was overturned, and several houses sustained shingle damage. Several trees were blown down. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF2 |SE of Hopkinsville |Christian |KY | |1704 – 1710 | | | |An industrial warehouse building was heavily damaged, steel utility poles were bent almost to the ground, several barns were destroyed, and two homes lost their metal roofs. Dozens of trees were uprooted. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |NW of Sharer |Butler |KY | |1726 – 1729 | | | |A section of a residence's roof was removed, trees were snapped, and a mobile home was moved off its foundation. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |SE of Neafus |Grayson |KY | |1738 – 1742 | | | |A number of trees were snapped or uprooted. Metal roofing was blown off a barn and a residence, one small but well- constructed shed was pushed onto its side, and another small shed was destroyed. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |Caneyville |Grayson |KY | |1741 – 1743 | | | |A tree was blown onto a restaurant, the metal roof was blown off a cinder block dugout on a baseball field and a mobile home, and three large grain bins were moved off their foundations. A tractor trailer was blown over, and several trees were snapped or uprooted. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |Waverly |Humphreys |TN | |1819 – 1822 | | | |Several businesses sustained significant roof damage, signs and overhangs were torn off, and dozens of trees were snapped or uprooted, several of which fell on homes and vehicles. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |E of McEwen |Dickson |TN | |1833 – 1841 | | | |Hundreds of trees were snapped or uprooted, several structures sustained significant roof damage, and several outbuildings and barns were heavily damaged. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |SSW of Ashland City |Cheatham |TN | |1852 – 1853 | | | |Dozens of trees were snapped or uprooted, and additional damage was observed in an inaccessible area east of the Cumberland River. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |W of Smyrna |Davidson, Rutherford |TN | |1920 – 1924 | | | |Numerous power poles were snapped, hundreds of trees were snapped or uprooted, some small storage buildings were destroyed, numerous homes sustained roof and siding damage, and several fences were blown down. A tractor trailer and several cargo trailers were overturned. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |SW of Georgetown |Grant |LA | |1942 – 1952 | | | |Numerous trees were snapped or uprooted, some of which fell on homes and a vehicle. Shingles were pulled from one house, and a tin roof was ripped from a shop. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |ENE of Hestand |Monroe |KY | |1955 – 1956 | | | |A large barn was destroyed, with debris thrown in several directions, and multiple trees were snapped or uprooted. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF2 |NE of Summerville to SW of Enterprise |LaSalle, Catahoula |LA | |1958 – 2009 | | | |The tornado began in LaSalle Parish, entering Catahoula Parish before dissipating. Numerous trees were snapped or uprooted, a hunting camp was heavily damaged, a mobile home was tossed down a ravine and destroyed, and a covered travel trailer was blown on to its side. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |SW of Albany |Clinton |KY | |2014 – 2015 | | | |The roof of a large boat storage barn was lifted and thrown, and a second storage shed was destroyed. A house had a window blown out. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |NNW of Seventy Six |Clinton |KY | |2016 – 2017 | | | |Multiple trees were snapped and uprooted. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF2 |SSE of Cooter Point, LA to NNW of Grand Gulf, MS |Tensas (LA), Claiborne (MS) |LA, MS | |2043 – 2114 | | | |The tornado began in Tensas Parish, Louisiana before dissipating in Claiborne County, Mississippi. Numerous homes, farms, and outbuildings sustained significant damage, a water treatment plant and antebellum home were majorly damaged, a grain silo received a huge dent, and an 18-wheeler was flipped over. Hundreds of trees were snapped and uprooted, and numerous power poles were snapped. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |WNW of Hebron |Licking |OH | |2046 – 2047 | | | |A large garage had a portion of its roof peeled off, a supporting post was snapped, one side of the building was blown inward, and metal doors on the opposite side were blown outward. A smaller garage sustained major damage to a metal door. A large section of metal and wood roofing was removed from a barn, a door was removed from a smaller storage shed, and a house sustained minor damage. A few trees were uprooted. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |NW of Williamsburg |Whitley |KY | |2103 – 2106 | | | |Many trees were downed or uprooted, and several barns and outbuildings sustained significant damage. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |NW of Utica |Hinds |MS | |2142 – 2145 | | | |A number of trees were snapped or uprooted, and two outbuildings were destroyed. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |ESE of Beaver |Floyd |KY | |2221 – 2226 | | | |A trailer home was destroyed, and approximately 100 trees were downed. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |NE of Athens |McMinn |TN | |2236 – 2240 | | | |The tornado downed 8 trees. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |Braxton |Simpson |MS | |2236 – 2242 | | | |Many trees were snapped or uprooted, some of which fell on vehicles. Many power lines were blown down. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |W of Ruth to ESE of Topeka |Lincoln, Lawrence |MS | |2248 – 2307 | | | |A gas station awning was destroyed, the back wall was blown out of a volunteer fire department building, a church had its steeple blown off and sustained extensive shingle damage, and numerous homes sustained various degrees of roof damage. Several trees were snapped or uprooted, some of which fell on vehicles and houses. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |E of Franklinton |Washington |LA | |2340 | | | |A home lost a large portion of its roof, and two mobile homes also sustained roof damage. Several large trees were uprooted. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |S of Killian |Livingston |LA | |2342 | | | |Several trees were snapped or uprooted, and a metal roof was peeled off a home. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |Gramercy area |St. James |LA | |2350 – 2352 | | | |A carport was lifted off a home, causing significant damage, and other buildings sustained minor to moderate roof damage. Significant tree damage was observed. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |SW of Bogalusa |Washington |LA | |0001 | | | |A trailer was lifted and thrown into a camper. Sheet metal, tin roofing, and an awning were tossed and wrapped around a tree. Numerous trees were snapped or uprooted. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |SSE of Poplarville |Pearl River |MS | |0043 | | | |Multiple trees were snapped or uprooted, and a portion of a metal roof was peeled off a home, breaking a few roof beams. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |NW of Neely to SSW of State Line |Greene |MS | |0043 – 0103 | | | |Thousands of trees were snapped or uprooted, some of which fell on the roofs of several homes and a church. A metal barn was destroyed. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |E of Ocean Springs |Jackson |MS | |0145 | | | |Roofing was removed from a few commercial buildings, windows were blown out of two houses, large sections of two fences were blown down, large tree limbs were snapped, and several trees were blown down. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |NE of Carters Lake |Gilmer |GA | |0133 – 0136 | | | |Hundreds of trees were blown down, uprooted, or snapped, inflicting various degrees of damage to approximately 100 homes. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |W of Ellijay |Gilmer |GA | |0134 – 0136 | | | |Several hundred trees were blown down, snapped, or uprooted, six chicken houses were heavily damaged or destroyed, a horse stable was destroyed, and three outbuildings were heavily damaged. | |- |} ===April 5 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Tuesday, April 5, 2011 |- ! scope="col" width="3%" align="center"|EF# ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" width="5%" align="center"|State ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort-type="number"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort-type="number"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort-type="number"|Path length ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort-type="number"|Max width ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort-type="number"|Damage ! scope="col" width="48%" class="unsortable" align="center"|Summary ! scope="col" width="3%" class="unsortable" align="center"|Refs |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |Ararat |Surry |NC | |0525 – 0528 | | | |About 35 to 40 homes sustained roof or shingle damage, carports collapsed on vehicles, and the windows were blown out at a community building. Numerous trees were felled, some of which landed on houses and barns. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |WNW of Walden |Bibb |GA | |0530 – 0532 | | | |Approximately 100 trees were blown down, snapped, or uprooted, inflicting minor to moderate damage to nine homes. The garage was blown out of one of the houses, shifting the home off its foundation and causing significant damage. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF2 |NW of Eastman |Dodge |GA | |0639 – 0642 | | | |1 death – a double-wide mobile home was completely destroyed, killing one of the occupants. Several trees were blown down or uprooted, and the roof and front porch of a second mobile home were destroyed. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |WNW of Mattawoman |Charles |MD | |0848 – 0849 | | | |A large tree was downed onto a house roof, and several others were snapped. A fence was damaged, and several outdoor objects were blown around. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |E of Collington |Prince George's, Anne Arundel |MD | |0855 – 0857 | | | |Numerous trees were topped or blown down. | |- |} ===April 7 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Thursday, April 7, 2011 |- ! scope="col" width="3%" align="center"|EF# ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" width="5%" align="center"|State ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Path length ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Max width ! scope="col" width="48%" class="unsortable" align="center"|Summary ! scope="col" width="3%" class="unsortable" align="center"|Refs |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |Rockville |Solano |CA | |2252 | | |Brief tornado damaged a strip plaza, a hair salon and a few signs in a commercial area. Minor tree damage was also reported. | |- |colspan="10" | Sources: SPC Storm Reports for 04/07/11, NWS Sacramento, NCDC Storm Data |} ===April 8 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Friday, April 8, 2011 |- ! scope="col" width="3%" align="center"|EF# ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" width="5%" align="center"|State ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Path length ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Max width ! scope="col" width="48%" class="unsortable" align="center"|Summary ! scope="col" width="3%" class="unsortable" align="center"|Refs |- |bgcolor=# | EF2 |Pulaski |Pulaski |VA | |2335 | | |Severe damage in town. Over 200 houses were damaged, of which at least 30 were destroyed and many others were severely damaged. Many trees were also uprooted. Nine people were injured. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |Draper |Pulaski |VA | |2342 | | |Many houses and a gas station were damaged at Exit 92 on Interstate 81 and a mobile home was destroyed. Many trees were also snapped. | |- |colspan="10" | Sources: NWS Blacksburg, NCDC Storm Data |} ===April 9 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Saturday, April 9, 2011 |- ! scope="col" width="3%" align="center"|EF# ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" width="5%" align="center"|State ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Path length ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Max width ! scope="col" width="48%" class="unsortable" align="center"|Summary ! scope="col" width="3%" class="unsortable" align="center"|Refs |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |Norton |Norton (city) |VA | |1945 |Unknown | |Two buildings were damaged and some trees were snapped. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |W of Valeria |Menifee, Wolfe |KY | |2000 |Unknown | |Hundreds of trees were damaged in the Daniel Boone National Forest. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |Valeria |Wolfe |KY | |2005 | | |Brief tornado touchdown with a carport and barn destroyed. Two houses and a vehicle were also damaged. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |Milligan College |Carter |TN | |2035 | | |Several trees were knocked down. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |E of Jonesborough |Washington |TN | |2200 | | |Three barns were heavily damaged and trees were twisted. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |ENE of McKinley |Washington |TN | |2208 | | |Several large trees were knocked down. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |N of Rocky Fork |Unicoi |TN | |2215 | | |Minor tree damage along the path. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |NNE of Shelby |Cleveland |NC | |2250 | | |Two mobile homes were flipped over, injuring one of the occupants. Several other houses sustained minor damage. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF3 |Mapleton area |Monona |IA | |0020 | | |Severe damage in town and a state of emergency was declared as a result of a large wedge tornado. Many houses and businesses were damaged or destroyed, representing about 60% of the town. In total, over 100 houses were destroyed. 14 people were injured. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |NW of Ricketts |Crawford |IA | |0037 | | |Tornado knocked down power lines. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF2 |W of Arthur |Ida |IA | |0115 | | |Several buildings, including a farm house, were heavily damaged and trees and power lines were damaged. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF3 |NW of Odebolt |Sac |IA | |0123 | | |Large wedge tornado damaged or destroyed several houses. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF2 |NNE of Odebolt |Sac |IA | |0129 | | |Numerous houses were damaged or destroyed. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |SSW of Early |Sac |IA | |0138 | | |Satellite tornado to the 0129 tornado remained over open country. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |S of Galva |Ida |IA | |0142 | | |A farmstead was severely damaged with numerous outbuildings destroyed and a home losing its roof. A few other structures, including an ethanol plant, were also damaged. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF3 |SW of Pocahontas (1st tornado) |Sac, Buena Vista, Pocahontas |IA | |0208 | | |Long-track, extremely large wedge tornado, with a damage swath 1.5 miles (2.4 km) wide, leveled several farmhouses and damaged others. Numerous farm buildings were also damaged or destroyed. Tornado remained on the ground for more than an hour. From 0256 to 0357 UTC (9:56 to 10:57 pm CDT), this was one of five tornadoes on the ground in Pocahontas County, three of which were satellite tornadoes to this. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |S of Sulphur Springs |Buena Vista |IA | |0214 | | |Brief tornado touchdown with no damage. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |S of Cherokee |Cherokee |IA | |0220 | | |Several structures sustained significant damage along the path and corn stubble was scoured. A confinement building was also destroyed by the tornado. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF2 |SW of Pocahontas (2nd tornado) |Sac, Buena Vista |IA | |0224 | | |Satellite tornado to the previous storm. Two buildings were heavily damaged. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |ESE of Newell |Buena Vista |IA | |0225 | | |Several outbuildings and farm buildings were damaged. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |SW of Alta |Buena Vista |IA | |0250 |Unknown | |First brief tornado touchdown in the area with no damage. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |WSW of Alta |Buena Vista |IA | |0250 |Unknown | |Second brief tornado touchdown in the area with no damage. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF4 |W of Pocahontas (1st tornado) |Pocahontas |IA | |0254 | | |Strongest tornado of the outbreak. One house was flattened by the tornado and swept off its foundation. A combine, estimated at was tossed roughly as well and many trees were debarked. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |WSW of Pocahontas (1st tornado) |Pocahontas |IA | |0255 | | |Satellite tornado to the EF4 Pocahontas tornado. On the ground at the same time as the following tornado. Relatively minor damage. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |WSW of Pocahontas (2nd tornado) |Pocahontas |IA | |0255 | | |Satellite tornado to the EF4 Pocahontas tornado. Anticyclonic tornado paired with the previous cyclonic tornado. Relatively minor damage. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF2 |W of Pocahontas (2nd tornado) |Pocahontas |IA | |0256 | | |Third satellite tornado to the EF4 Pocahontas tornado which was later absorbed by that violent wedge. One home was severely damaged. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |W of Pocahontas (3rd tornado) |Pocahontas |IA | |0308 | | |One house was damaged. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |NW of St. Joseph |Kossuth |IA | |0419 | | |A hog barn was damaged, numerous windows blown out and half of a shed collapsed. | |- |colspan="10" | Sources: NWS Sioux Falls, NWS Omaha, NWS Des Moines, NCDC Storm Data |} ===April 10 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Sunday, April 10, 2011 |- ! scope="col" width="3%" align="center"|EF# ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" width="5%" align="center"|State ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Path length ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Max width ! scope="col" width="48%" class="unsortable" align="center"|Summary ! scope="col" width="3%" class="unsortable" align="center"|Refs |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |SW of Augusta |Eau Claire |WI | |2157 | | |Brief tornado destroyed a garage and damaged two farmsteads and a barn. Earliest tornado to touch down in Eau Claire County during the course of a year on record. Previous earliest was May 10\. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |NW of Augusta |Eau Claire |WI | |2204 | | |Two outbuildings destroyed and three more damaged. Significant tree damage as well. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF3 |Merrill area |Marathon, Lincoln |WI | |2308 | | |Severe damage in the area, especially at and around the Merrill Airport where hangars and airplanes were destroyed. Throughout Merrill, 65 houses were damaged or destroyed. One person was thrown from his home after the tornado destroyed his home and he was seriously injured. One other person was injured. Overall damage was estimated at $10.8 million, most of which took place at an industrial park. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF2 |Cottonville area |Adams |WI | |2312 | | |Numerous houses sustained roof damage and mobile homes were destroyed. Extensive tree damage also occurred along with barns and sheds destroyed. A camping trailer was also overturned and sheet metal was wrapped around trees. Preliminary losses from the tornado reached $2.25 million. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |SSW of Necedah |Juneau |WI | |2314 | | |A mobile home was rolled over and pine trees were snapped. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |SW of Hancock |Adams, Waushara |WI | |2330 | | |Trees and power poles downed. Houses sustained roof damage and irrigation systems were destroyed. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |SE of Parrish |Langlade |WI | |2350 | | |Extensive tree damage along the path affecting over 1600 acres and one million trees. One cabin was destroyed. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |S of Fremont |Waushara, Waupaca, Outagamie |WI | |0016 | | |Multiple barns were destroyed and highway signs were damaged. The roof was torn off one house in Readfield and the steeple was torn off the church. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF2 |E of Argonne |Forest, Florence |WI | |0030 | | |Extensive tree and power line damage. A roof was torn off of a home and several barns and garages were destroyed as well. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |NE of Poy Sippi |Waushara, Winnebago |WI | |0053 | | |Intermittent tornado touchdown with barns and buildings damaged. Roof damage to houses occurred and extensive tree damage occurred. Crossed over Lake Poygan into Winnebago County where mobile homes were damaged and flipped. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |W of Armstrong Creek |Forest |WI | |0103 | | |A house was damaged and a garage was destroyed. Many trees were snapped in the area. Barns were also destroyed. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |SE of Berlin |Green Lake |WI | |0127 | | |Trees were snapped and a wooden structure was damaged. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF2 |Kaukauna area |Outagamie |WI | |0143 | | |Over 180 houses were damaged in the community, some of them losing roofs. Large trees were uprooted or snapped. A church sustained roof damage and had air conditioning units torn off. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |S of Greenleaf |Brown |WI | |0153 | | |Silos were damaged and a barn roof was ripped off. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |S of Stockbridge |Calumet |WI | |0159 | | |Minor damage to four houses and the roof was torn off of a metal storage building. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |N of Rogersville |Webster |MO | |0355 | | |Damage to trees and outbuildings. | |- |colspan="10" | Sources: NWS Twin Cities, NWS La Crosse, NWS Green Bay, NWS Springfield, NCDC Storm Data |} ===April 11 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Monday, April 11, 2011 |- ! scope="col" width="3%" align="center"|EF# ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" width="5%" align="center"|State ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Path length ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Max width ! scope="col" width="48%" class="unsortable" align="center"|Summary ! scope="col" width="3%" class="unsortable" align="center"|Refs |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |NNW of Rio Vista |Johnson |TX | |0609 | | |Five houses were damaged, one of them heavily and a wall was torn from a pharmacy. Mobile homes were also damaged and barns were destroyed. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |Alvarado |Johnson |TX | |0622 | | |Five commercial buildings were damaged and mobile homes were flipped. Two people were injured. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |Forney area |Kaufman |TX | |0713 | | |Several houses sustained roof damage and a truck stop sign was blown over. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |S of Cash |Hunt |TX | |0734 | | |Two houses were heavily damaged and numerous other houses sustained lesser damage. Damage to trees and sheds as well. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |Vestavia Hills |Jefferson |AL | |0027 | | |Brief tornado embedded in larger microburst. One house was heavily damaged and numerous trees were snapped.\ | |- |colspan="10" | Sources: NWS Fort Worth, NWS Birmingham, NCDC Storm Data |} ===April 14 to April 16 events=== A total of 178 tornadoes touched down in this large tornado outbreak. scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort- type="number"|Max width ! scope="col" width="48%" class="unsortable" align="center"|Summary ! scope="col" width="3%" class="unsortable" align="center"|Refs |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |SW of Winnemucca |Humboldt |NV | |1755 | | |Tornado remained over open country. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |N of Baird (1st tornado) |Callahan |TX | |2028 | | |Damage limited to a few tree limbs. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |Ibex |Shackelford |TX | |2055 |Unknown | |Brief tornado uprooted a few trees. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |ENE of Potosi |Taylor |TX | |2122 |Unknown | |Brief tornado touchdown with no damage. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |N of Baird (2nd tornado) |Callahan |TX | |Unknown |2 miles (3.2 km) | |Rope tornado reported by storm chasers. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |SE of Scipio |Pittsburg |OK | |2205 | | |A barn and a house sustained roof damage and trees were snapped. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |N of Baird (3rd tornado) |Callahan |TX | |2215 |Unknown | |Damage limited to a few tree limbs. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |N of Baird (4th tornado) |Callahan |TX | |2227 | | |Large multiple-vortex tornado remained over open country. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |SE of Monroe |Le Flore |OK | |0003 |Unknown | |Brief tornado damaged a roof of a house. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |NW of Coleman |Callahan |TX | |0127 |Unknown | |Brief tornado pictured by a storm chaser with no damage. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF1 |N of Umpire |Howard |AL | |0354 | | |Extensive tree damage in the area and a section of roof was torn from a house. A large storage building was destroyed and a chicken house was damaged. | |- |colspan="10" | Sources: SPC Storm Reports for 04/24/11, NCDC Storm Data |} ===April 25 to April 28 events=== A total of 360 tornadoes touched down in this extremely large tornado outbreak; 359 tornadoes were in the United States and 1 was in Canada. For more details, see List of tornadoes in the 2011 Super Outbreak. ===April 30 event=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |+ List of confirmed tornadoes – Saturday, April 30, 2011 |- ! scope="col" width="3%" align="center"|EF# ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" class="unsortable"|Location ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" class="unsortable"|County / Parish ! scope="col" width="5%" align="center"|State ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort-type="number"|Start Coord. ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort-type="number"|Time (UTC) ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort-type="number"|Path length ! scope="col" width="6%" align="center" data-sort-type="number"|Max width ! scope="col" width="48%" class="unsortable" align="center"|Summary ! scope="col" width="3%" class="unsortable" align="center"|Refs |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |SW of Hainesville |Wood |TX | |0006 | | |Minor damage with trees snapped. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |NE of Thomas |Upshur |TX | |0126 | | |A few trees were snapped or uprooted. | |- |bgcolor=# | EF0 |Hughes Springs |Cass |TX | |0224 | | |Several houses sustained minor damage and trees and power lines were knocked down. | |- |colspan="10" | Sources: SPC Storm Reports for 04/30/11, NCDC Storm Data |} ==See also== * Tornadoes of 2011 ==References== ==Notes== United States,04 Tornadoes,04 2011,04 Tornadoes zh:2011年美國龍捲風災
